content.text:
# Recent Eliza Project Updates

The Eliza project has seen significant development activity with numerous features, bugfixes, and improvements across various components.

## New Features

### New Plugins and Integrations
- Added Dutch (Nederlands) translation (PR #1909)
- Added GoPlus Security Plugin to enhance security for agents (PR #1898)
- Added Hyperfy support (PR #1896)
- Added OpenWeather plugin (PR #1880)
- Added Binance plugin (PR #1812)
- Added zktls-reclaim plugin (PR #1558)
- Added Spheron plugin (PR #1966)
- Added Anyone plugin for privatizing network requests (PR #1960)
- Added Allora plugin (PR #1955)
- Added Arthera Chain plugin (PR #1818)
- Added coin price plugin supporting CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko & CoinCap (PR #1808)
- Added Fraxtal chain to EVM (PR #1954)

### Platform Enhancements
- Added remote attestation action (PR #1885)
- Added support for wildcard in TWITTER_TARGET_USERS (PR #1884)
- Implemented recommended settings in Jupiter swap (PR #1882)
- Optimized Agent Action Processing by prioritizing timelines and limiting actions per cycle (PR #1824)
- Added pglite database adapter (PR #1810)
- Made templates in composeContext dynamic (PR #1467)
- Added Solana token deployment using Solana agent kit (PR #1373)
- Added debug logging for context (PR #1980)
- Improved Twitter paragraph splitting when containing URLs (PR #1947)
- Added support for EternalAI provider with chain_id extra data and request/response logging (PR #1938, PR #1948)

## Bugfixes

- Fixed typo in CHANGELOG.md (PR #1922)
- Fixed handling of empty input text to avoid memory content empty error (PR #1919)
- Fixed evaluators null check in core (PR #1918)
- Resolved type-related errors and ensured project compiles (PR #1917)
- Fixed SUMMARIZE prompt in Discord client (PR #1916)
- Fixed Twitter result object undefined properties (PR #1905)
- Fixed integrations and smoke tests (PR #1893)
- Removed case sensitive path (PR #1892)
- Fixed broken API Documentation URL (PR #1881)
- Fixed SQLITE ERROR with zero-length vectors (PR #1984)
- Fixed Telegram templates (PR #1982)
- Fixed database initialization race condition affecting builds (PR #1968)
- Fixed abstract readme (PR #1963)
- Fixed error in C3PO and improved error handling feedback (PR #1951)
- Limited the number of timelines fetched (PR #1931)
- Removed unused variable X_SERVER_URL (PR #1930)
- Changed test structure for core package and fixed failing outdated tests (PR #1989)

## Testing and Documentation

- Added tests for discord-client (PR #1927)
- Added test setup for telegram client (PR #1879)
- Added tests for Twitter plugin and Twitter client (PR #1976, PR #1959)
- Added embedding tests (PR #1944)
- Updated API route (PR #1923)
- Added "What Did You Get Done This Week? #8" notes (PR #1894)
- Updated documentation to use processAction instead of triggerAction (PR #1937)
- Updated diagram (PR #1907)

## Other Changes

- Enabled strict null checks in core (PR #1878)
- Enabled all EVM chains by default (PR #1981)
- Implemented cleaner logs on agent startup (PR #1973)
- Added more specific RPC URLs (PR #1945)
- Removed unused imports from Conflux plugin (PR #1941)

categories.title: Recent Issues in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub Repository

content.text:
Several technical issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza repository, including:

- CUDA detection problems with llama-local (#1926)
- Agent startup failures with the postgres adapter due to "tuple concurrently updated" errors (#1914)
- messageExamples errors (#1929)
- Discord integration using disallowed intents (#1940)

Multiple Twitter/social media integration issues have been identified:

- Incorrect formatting of Twitter posts (#1920)
- Security alerts triggered by repeated logins when posting to Twitter (#1969)
- Agents generating tweets but failing to publish them (#1958)

User experience issues have also been reported:

- Repetitive answers unrelated to questions (#1900)
- Client chat not automatically scrolling down or focusing input after character responses (#1977)

Additionally, there was a question about contributing to the project (#1891).

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests to the Eliza Repository

content.text: The Eliza repository has seen significant development activity with multiple pull requests focused on adding new plugins and integrations. Several contributors have submitted PRs to enhance Eliza's functionality across different platforms and services.

New plugins being added include zktls-reclaim (PR #1558), Binance (PR #1812), Obsidian integration (PR #1943), Spheron (PR #1966), and Instagram client (PR #1964). These additions significantly expand Eliza's connectivity with various platforms and services.
There have also been infrastructure improvements, including PR #1893 which fixes integrations and smoke tests, and PR #1373 which adds Solana token deployment capabilities using the Solana agent kit.

General maintenance PRs include an update to Eliza (PR #1911) by DannyDesert and a fork synchronization (PR #1978) by lachiejames, ensuring the codebase remains current and aligned with the main repository.

The crypto market shows price changes for several cryptocurrencies between two reporting periods:

WETH increased from $3,635.17 to $3,687.04, representing a gain of $51.87 or approximately 1.43%.

SOL rose from $213.29 to $218.40, showing an increase of $5.11 or about 2.40%.

WBTC climbed from $98,056.27 to $101,840.17, a significant jump of $3,783.90 or roughly 3.86%.

ai16z saw the largest percentage increase, moving from $1.81 to $2.19, gaining $0.38 or approximately 21.05%.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed increased activity over a two-day period. From January 6-7, 2025, there were 30 new pull requests (with 26 merged), 16 new issues, and 78 active contributors. Activity increased the following day (January 7-8, 2025) with 36 new pull requests (30 merged), 24 new issues, and 91 active contributors. This represents a 20% increase in pull requests, a 50% increase in new issues, and a 16.7% increase in active contributors day-over-day.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
